H0.text: An ice cube melting can only result from light energy, as Ned learned that light is a source of energy.

H1.text: A rainbow forming can only result from light energy, as Ned learned that light is a source of energy.

H2.text: Water evaporating can only result from light energy, as Ned learned that light is a source of energy.

H3.text: Thunder booming can only result from light energy, according to Ned’s learning that light is a source of energy.

A4.text: Shen Kuo hypothesised—as Sun Sikong did before him—that rainbows were formed by a phenomenon of sunlight encountering droplets of rain in the air.

A5.text: the colours of the rainbow are phenomena of the decomposition of light.
